$comment: NOTE: This file is for human reference ONLY. For programmatic use, use the GET '/json_schema/response/$schema_name' endpoints, or within conch itself, json-schema/response.yaml.

vendor_name.$comment: the vendor's name for the datacenter
the vendor's name for the room

disks.$comment: disks is included only when device 'phase' is earlier than 'production'

latest_report.$comment: the contents of the device report. Given its age we cannot provide a schema.

location.$comment: location is included only when device 'phase' is earlier than 'production'

nics.$comment: nics is included only when device 'phase' is earlier than 'production'

target_hardware_product.$comment: Details of the hardware product the device is expected to be based on its current position and the rack layout.

report.$comment: the contents of the device report. Given its age we cannot provide a schema.

Error.$comment: this is the superset of all error schemas

bios_firmware.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
bios_firmware.title: BIOS Firmware

cpu_num.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
cpu_num.title: Number of CPUs

cpu_type.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
cpu_type.title: CPU Type

dimms_num.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
dimms_num.title: Number of DIMMs

hba_firmware.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
hba_firmware.title: HBA Firmware

nics_num.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
nics_num.title: Number of NICs

nvme_ssd_num.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
nvme_ssd_num.title: Number of NVME SSDs

nvme_ssd_size.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
nvme_ssd_size.title: NVME SSD Size

nvme_ssd_slots.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
nvme_ssd_slots.title: NVME SSD Slots

psu_total.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
psu_total.title: PSU Total

raid_lun_num.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
raid_lun_num.title: Number of RAID LUNs

ram_total.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
ram_total.title: RAM Total

sas_hdd_num.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
sas_hdd_num.title: Number of SAS HDDs

sas_hdd_size.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
sas_hdd_size.title: SAS HDD Size

sas_hdd_slots.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
sas_hdd_slots.title: SAS HDD Slots

sas_ssd_num.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
sas_ssd_num.title: Number of SAS SSDs

sas_ssd_size.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
sas_ssd_size.title: SAS SSD Size

sas_ssd_slots.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
sas_ssd_slots.title: SAS SSD Slots

sata_hdd_num.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
sata_hdd_num.title: Number of SATA HDDs

sata_hdd_size.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
sata_hdd_size.title: SATA HDD Size

sata_hdd_slots.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
sata_hdd_slots.title: SATA HDD Slots

sata_ssd_num.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
sata_ssd_num.title: Number of SATA SSDs

sata_ssd_size.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
sata_ssd_size.title: SATA SSD Size

sata_ssd_slots.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2

usb_num.$comment: this property will be moved into /specification in v3.2
usb_num.title: Number of USBs

validation_plan_id.$comment: this property will become nullable in v3.3 and removed in v4.0
validation_plan_id.title: Validation Plan ID

JSONSchema.$comment: this is the structure for responses from GET /json_schema/:type/:name/:version and GET /json_schema/:uuid, which fetches JSON Schemas from the database

allOf.$comment: Here we are essentially adding on to the main "schema" definition defined in the metaschema.
Here we are adding on additional requirements for the top level schema only.

absolute_schema_location.$comment: usually a uri - except when validating against a new schema, or referencing a json_schema in the database

JSONSchemaOnDisk.$comment: this is the structure for responses from GET /json_schema/[query_params|request|response|common_device_report]/:name only

allOf.$comment: Here we are essentially adding on to the main "schema" definition defined in the metaschema.
Here we are adding on additional requirements for the top level schema only.

LegacyValidation.$comment: this definition will be removed in v4.0

LegacyValidationPlan.$comment: this definition will be removed in v4.0

LegacyValidationPlans.$comment: this definition will be removed in v4.0

LegacyValidations.$comment: this definition will be removed in v4.0

data.$comment: the parsed form of the query parameters, as they were passed to the schema for validation

error.const: query parameters did not match required format
request did not match required format

ValidationError.$comment: base structure for all query_param, request, response validation error responses

data.$comment: any supplementary details will be included here
